intro: Machaeranthera gracilis, commonly known as the slenderleaf false aster, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has slender, hairy stems with small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually pink to purple, with ray florets surrounding a central disk, and it blooms from late spring to early summer. Machaeranthera gracilis is often found in open woodlands and grasslands, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
